data.title: National Film Awards 2023 Winners List: Best Actor, Actress, Director, Movie and More
data.meta_description: National Film Awards 2023 Winners List: National Film Awards 2023 honoured the best films of 2021 in Indian cinema. This awards ceremony was originally slated to be held on 3 May 2022 but was postponed due to COVID-19 pandemic.
data.text:
National Film Award Winners 2023: The 69th National Film Award Ceremony successfully happened at Vigyan Bhawan in Delhi. Every year, the government appoints a national panel to choose the winning submission. The President of India then gives the awards, followed by the launch of a National Film Festival, where award-winning films are screened. Declared for films made in the preceding year all throughout the nation, they have the distinction of honouring the best of Indian cinema on the whole as well as giving out prizes for the greatest films in each of the nation's regions and languages. This year, Alia Bhatt, Kriti Sanon, Allu Arjun and various other actors for their exemplary craft.

List of National Film Awards 2023

In 1954, the National Awards were presented. The ceremony was created by the Indian government to celebrate films produced all throughout the country and to promote the dissemination of Indian art and culture. Check the list of award recipients for the latest edition below:

Category

Winner 2023

Best Feature Film

Rocketry

Best Director

Nikhil Mahajan, Godavari

Nargis Dutt Award for Best Feature Film on National Integration:

The Kashmir Files

Best Actor

Allu Arjun, Pushpa

Best Popular Film Providing Wholesome Entertainment

RRR

Best Actress

Alia Bhatt, Gangubai Kathiawadi

Kriti Sanon, Mimi

Best Supporting Actor

Pankaj Tripathi, Mimi

Best Supporting Actress

Pallavi Joshi, The Kashmir Files

Best Child Artist

Bhavin Rabari, Chhello Show

Best Kannada Film:

Charlie 777

Best Hindi Film

Sardar Udham

Best Lyrics

Chandrabose, Konda Polam's Dham Dham Dham

Best Female Playback Singer:

Shreya Ghoshal, Iravin Nizhal

Best Male Playback Singer

Best Music Direction (Background Music)

MM Keeravaani, RRR

Best Music Director (Songs):

Devi Sri Prasad, Pushpa

Best Dialogue Writer

Utkarshini Vashishtha & Prakash Kapadia, Gangubai Kathiawadi

Best Screenplay (Adapted)

Sanjay Leela Bhansali & Utkarshini Vashishtha, Gangubai Kathiawadi

Best Screenplay (Original)

Shahi Kabir, Nayattu

Best Malayalam Film

Home

Best Gujarati Film

Chhello Show

Best Tamil Film:

Kadaisi Vivasayi

Best Telugu Film

Uppena

Best Maithili Film

Samantar

Best Cinematography

Avik Mukhopadhayay, Sardar Udham

Best Choreography

Prem Rakshith, RRR

Best Audiography (Re-recordist of the final mixed track)

Sinoy Joseph, Sardar Udham

Best Audiography (Sound Designer)

Aneesh Basu, Jhilli

Best Audiography (Location Sound Recordist)

Arun Asok & Sonu K P, Chavittu

Best Children's Film

Gandhi & Co.

Best Film on Environment Conservation/Preservation:

Best Film on Social Issues

Anunaad-The Resonance

Indira Gandhi Award for Best Debut Film of a Director

Meppadiyan, Vishnu Mohan

Best Odiya Film

Pratikshya

Best Meiteilon Film

Eikhoihi Yum

Best Assamese Film

Anur

Kalkokkho

Ekda Kaay Zala

Preetisheel Singh, Gangubai Kathiawadi

Best Editing

Sanjay Leela Bhansali, Gangubai Kathiawadi

Best Production Design

Dmitrii Malich and Mansi Dhruv Mehta, Sardar Udham

Best Special Effects

Srinivas Mohan, RRR

Best Costume Designer

Veera Kapur Ee, Sardar Udham

Special Jury Award

Shershaah, Vishnuvardhan

Best Stunt Choreography

King Soloman, RRR
